DOC.brief_summary: New Nordic diet guideline advocate reduction consumption protein animal source beef pork , due environmental concern . Instead , intake protein vegetable source legumes pulse increase . However , little known effect protein ( Nordic grow ) bean peas body weight appetite regulation . The objective study examine protein vegetable source ( bean peas ) comparable protein animal source regard acute meal-induced satiety .
DOC.brief_title: Effect Protein From Animal Vegetable Sources Appetite
DOC.detailed_description: Design : Single-blind randomized 3-way crossover meal study Subjects : - 48 young healthy men ( Age : 18-50 year ; BMI : 19-30 kg/m2 ) . - Expected completers : n=42 . End point : - Subjective appetite ( VAS ) ( every 30 min 3 hour ) - Ad libitum energy intake ( 3 hour test meal ) Experimental diet : Iso-caloric breakfast meal ( 3.5 MJ ) energy density : A. Fava bean + Split pea ( 20 protein E % ) B. Fava bean + Split pea + potato ( 10 protein E % ) C. Pork/beef + potato ( 20 protein E % )
DOC.criteria: healthy men 1850 body mass index ( BMI ) 18.530.0 smoke participation study 4 mo prior entry weight gain/loss > 3 kg mo prior entry Strenuous physical activity > 10 h/wk Use medication affect appetite food allergy relevance test meal Psychiatric metabolic disorder prohibit participation
